description: Use this to build the mapping template (incoming_schema, expected_schema). The template maps your file headers to these exact expected_schema values. The engine writes to tables: sources, leads, owners, lead_appendix_kv.

source_name.how: Provided at run time via CLI: --source "Your Source Name". Not a column in the file. This is the name for this data source (e.g. file name or vendor name).

leads.notes: phone_clean is derived from phone_raw if not mapped. second_phone_clean is derived from second_phone_raw. Map your file columns to these names in the template expected_schema column. source_id is added by the engine from --source.

owners.notes: owner_phone_clean is derived from owner_phone if not mapped. lead_id is added by the engine (one owner per lead). Map your file columns to these names in the template expected_schema column.

template_format: CSV with two columns: incoming_schema (your file header), expected_schema (one of the values above). Use 'first name + last name' in incoming_schema to combine columns into one expected_schema (e.g. owner_name).
